availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David L. Cook (Second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, tinner. Kentucky native. Son of John Cook and Harriet Cook. Tinner in Fayette County in 1860. Second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from May 25, 1863, to December 23, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 1, p. 155A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 2, p. 57.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 138-39.
